entry.title: p13n: fix recent images leak between accounts
entry.content:
When getting the list of recent Sea Pen images, the sea pen directory is

not specified for a specific account. So it will show the images of all

accounts. Update the Sea Pen directory to fix the issue.



Bug: b/322013532

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*SeaPen*"

Test: Switch between different accounts and confirm images not leaked.

Change-Id: I8bae675a1ff5819604d4fbe44479a5cd66eeb848

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5230304

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Rename mouse lock to pointer lock
entry.content:
When the code was originally written, "mouse lock" was a popular term in

the gaming industry and the PointerLock API didn't even exist. Now that

"pointer lock" is an established term, we are switching our codebase

away from the old term to be consistent with the web platform API:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Pointer_Lock_API



There still are some names that aren't renamed in this CL, e.g. enum

values recorded in metrics.



There should be no behavioral changes.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE This is a rename CL

Bug: 1518948

Change-Id: Ib66d87e4919c2570109d7e6755ea91dfc18d42fc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5148491

entry.title: v4l2: Change secure buffer allocation to use a pool
entry.content:
Previously we would allocate secure buffers and attach them each to a

V4L2Buffer and pin them there for the whole duration of decoding. Now we

are allocating them as a pool in V4L2Queue and then attaching them to

the V4L2Buffer as needed when the buffer is submitted to the queue. This

allows re-use of secure buffers across multiple V4L2Buffer submissions

which is needed for AV1 when there are multiple frames per sample.



BUG=b:248610914

TEST=secure playback works on geralt



Change-Id: Ia080609143bb624982f104285c22eacb2ebe2834

entry.title: Reduce memory usage of NavigationPredictor AnchorElementData
entry.content:
NavigationPredictor stores a map of information about anchor elements

which can grow quite large, especially for long lived pages with many

anchors.



The following fields are not used and are now removed:

ratio_visible_area, ratio_distance_center_to_visible_top,

ratio_distance_root_bottom.



We change AnchorElementData to no longer store the

blink::mojom::AnchorElementMetrics sent by the renderer, but have fields

to only store the required information. Fields that do not need to be

stored are omitted. Some fields can use a smaller type to store the

necessary information (e.g. the font size is bucketed, and only needs 1

byte to represent possible values). bools are packed together with bit

fields. Fields are arranged to reduce the padding needed for alignment.



Using base::trace_event::EstimateMemoryUsage, the memory usage for the

youtube home page was 56,480 bytes. With this change, it's reduced to

44,960 bytes.



Bug: 1506262, 1419556

Change-Id: Ie430df1626b44ef80af6715f35d91b5f807f24d6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234754

Reviewed-by: Jeremy Roman

entry.title: Update WaylandCursorPosition during a drag and drop session
entry.content:
Currently WaylandCursorPosition is only updated while mouse events are

processed. Due to this, display::Screen::GetCursorScreenPoint(), which

depends on WaylandCursorPosition, can return incorrect coordinates while

processing a drag and drop.



This CL fixes that bug by updating the cursor position while some data

is dragged over Wayland windows.

entry.title: [Shortstand] Update install method in web app tab strip tests.
entry.content:
Currently in WebAppTabStripBrowserTest and

WebAppTabStripLinkCapturingBrowserTest, we use user display mode =

kTabbed to install tabbed mode app. However in real life,

display_mode_override is used to set tabbed mode instead. In addition to

that, with shortstand enabled, the user display mode kTabbed will not be

used anymore in the code, hence some tests will start failing when we

turn on the flag. This CL fixes this issue.

entry.title: Delete unused SilenceDetector
entry.content:
The use of SilenceDetector to replace AudioPowerMonitor turned out to

have too many edge cases: it's possible to have a stream that is

inaudible (below -72 dbfs) but not completely zero'ed (-inf dbfs). Such

a stream would prevent a tab's priority from being downgraded due to

inaudiblity, for an indefinite period of time.



Accounting for this scenario required more complexity than adding a

small a grace period to avoid transitioning to a silent state based off

of AudioPowerMonitor's output, which is landing in this CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5191730

entry.title: Notification: Remove NOTREACHED and add new enums for metrics
entry.content:
The crash in the bug is caused by an assumption we have in the code for

notification: If a notification is of type APPLICATION (notifications

coming from PWA, extension, etc.), we expect the priority is set to be

in the range from -2 to 2. This assumption/NOTREACHED should be removed

since we don't have control over the priority that an app notification

can have.



This CL also improve our notification metrics by creating 3 new enums:

an enum for crostini notification and an enum for application

notification when the priority is outside of [-2, 2] range.



Fixed: b:289129511

entry.title: Revert "Bugfix: Stop the warmed-up service worker correctly"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 73272464b7e9ca8c25fd751e4309cce8eab6b3d3.



Reason for revert: https://crbug.com/1521360



Original change's description:

> Bugfix: Stop the warmed-up service worker correctly

>

> Before this CL, when the warmed-up service worker is requested to stop,

> the service worker surprisingly starts instead of stopping. This CL

> fixes this bug.

>

> The bug was located in the ServiceWorkerVersion. Before this CL,

> start_callbacks_ contained remaining callbacks while the service worker

> was warming up or warmed up. These remaining callbacks are checked in

> ServiceWorkerVersion::OnStoppedInternal() like the following.

>

> bool should_restart = !start_callbacks_.empty();

>

> The should_restart flag becomes true, and the service worker is

> restarted. This CL fixes this problem by flushing callbacks beforehand.

>

entry.title: [Incognito Reauth] Handle an empty or slow TabSwitcherCustomViewManager
entry.content:
With Hub we have infrequently triggered a bug where the TabSwitcher and

by extension the TabSwitcherCustomViewManager is not ready when

IncognitoReauth tries to show leading to a crash.



Fix this by

1) Checking for the TabSwitcherCustomViewManager before trying to show.

2) Try to show the dialog once it is available in case it blocked an

attempt to show.



Bug: 1521099

entry.title: [wpt-exporter] Add debug log for PRs not marked as "ready for review"
entry.content:
In GraphQL [0], errors are indicated via the repsonse payload instead of

by non-2xx HTTP statuses. Temporarily log such errors in the exporter to

diagnose PRs not leaving the draft state.



Also, try quoting the `pullRequestId`. GraphQL seems to require the ID

type to be formatted as a string with quotes [1, 2].



[0]: https://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-Errors

[1]: https://spec.graphql.org/June2018/#sec-ID

[2]: https://gist.github.com/jeromepl/02e70f3ea4a4e8103da6f96f14eb213c#file-mark_as_ready_for_review-sh-L55

entry.title: [Android TRM] Add TestSupport; make TabResumptionModuleCoordinator more testable.
entry.content:
To prepare for Tab Resumption Module's upcoming data pipeline work, this

CL applies minor refactoring:

* Add TestSupport: This absorbs test constants and helpers to allow

reuse.

* UnitTest classes can extend TestSupport to direct use its content

without "TestSupport.".

* Add makeBitmap(), taken from TabResumptionModuleSuggestionsUnitTest.

* Add makeTimestamp() to make timestamp constants look nicer.

* TabResumptionModuleCoordinator:

* Simplify CTOR to take a ViewStub instead of {ViewGroup, int}.

* Improve testability via overrides:

* Change "private" members to "protected".

* Move TabResumptionModuleMediator instantiation (depends on

PropertyModel to be instantiated first) to a helper function.

* Minor tweaks to test values (e.g., timestamps)

entry.title: [Grid] Improve DCHECKs for GridSizingSubtree validity
entry.content:
Previously, whenever a `GridSizingSubtree` was passed as a parameter to

any grid method we only checked that the subtree contained a pointer to

a sizing tree. However, we didn't validate that the provided subtree

root belonged to the `BlockNode` we were processing.



Introducing logic to verify that any provided subtree root matches the

respective node when recursing into a subgrid's algorithm.



This change shouldn't have any behavioral impact.

triggered using the Set / Get Window Rect WebDriver command. This way

of using the eventSender to emit a fake event.

these commands.

entry.title: Add silence detection cooldown
entry.content:
This CL adds a grace period when a stream's audio power level dips

below our audibility threshold, before the stream is considered to be

silent.



This is necessary because the AudioPowerMonitor is configured to be

extremely reactive, and a single 20ms glitch is enough to have us

change from the audible to silent state. This in turn can cause a

backgrounded thread to have its priority lowered after a single

glitch.

separate process to ash-chrome and so they have to use the Fusebox

flavored base::FilePath.

a zip file served by the ODFS (One Drive File System) extension".

entry.title: [editing] Adjust the cursor position to the right without crossing the editable boundary between non-editable sibling nodes
entry.content:
Consider this test case:



Hello

|NN





Move the cursor to the right, and it disappears,

leaving you unable to retrieve it even with the left key.



In the example, `non_editable_node` is `B`,

`editable_position` is `DIV#ce@offset2`.

`non_editable_node` is a child node of the `editable_position`, hence

it will obtain the next candidate, which is a non-editable position.



If `non_editable_node` is not the last child of `editable_position`,

`InsertListCommand::DoApply` will proceed without any issues.



Bug: 1334557

entry.title: Make system_cpu::CpuProbe able to call StartSampling twice
entry.content:
In order to share this with services/device/compute_pressure, CpuProbe

needs to support calling `StartSampling` again after it has already

been called in order to get a new baseline. This is so that when

CpuProbeManager stops periodic sampling, and wants to start it again

after a long time has passed, it can refresh the baseline, instead of

using an old measurement from before periodic sampling was stopped.



The initial solution that was considered was to have a `StopSampling`

method to reset `got_probe_baseline_` to false, however that has

complications such as a race condition when `StartSampling` is called

and then `StopSampling` is called, before `Update` finishes and

`OnSamplingStarted` is able to set `got_probe_baseline_` to true.



Bug: 1509543

Change-Id: I529a1cf8be8b79d456e4641e1cea42ea5c913713

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5214653

Reviewed-by: Joe Mason

entry.title: Add CrOS enterprise policy for VirtualKeyboardSmartVisibilityEnabled.
entry.content:
The CrOS Virtual Keyboard has had a heuristic feature called

"transient blur" for many years. Normally, the virtual keyboard only

appears when the user has explicitly tapped on the input field. However,

this is quite clumsy on multi-screen login flows that show one input

field at a time: the user needs to tap on the input field.



With "transient blur", the virtual keyboard will appear when an input

field is focused even if the user didn't tap on the input field, as

long as two conditions are fulfilled:

- The previous focus was lost because the input field disappeared

(and not because the user dismissed it, for example)

- The previous focus was lost within a short time before now.



However, this feature can disrupt working with certain apps. So this

CL adds a policy to retroactively control this feature.



The policy calls this "Smart Visibility" to avoid the opaque technical

term "transient blur".



Bug: b/315079152

Change-Id: I489cc520d8015c6d7a327bad398e4c99f512de1f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5221800

entry.title: Fix OpenXR for Official Builds
entry.content:
It seems as though Java asserts are stripped out on official builds.

This change thus moves a call that was happening inside of an assert

(which had the side effect of continuing the requestSession call) to

outside of it, while still asserting on the result returned from it.

This unblocks launching an OpenXR session on official builds on

Android.

entry.title: Reland "[Read Anything] Synchronized selection for click and drag selections"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4ef46cdfcd8a7e5cbf2cb1e3178c87f9fcf18f79



The original change caused some selection tests to fail because of

GetTreeFromId(). That call is now moved behind a check that allows the

tests to pass (while still preserving the original functionality).



Original change's description:

> [Read Anything] Synchronized selection for click and drag selections

>

> When a user clicks and drags their cursor to highlight text on a web

> page (such that the anchor stays the same and the focus changes),

> multiple selection events are fired (one for each update to the

> selection). After a few selections, the EventFrom parameter of the event

> changes from kUser to kPage.

>

> This CL allows the text selection on the main web page to be propagated

> to Reading mode even after the EventFrom changes to kPage.

>

> Bug: 1451820

> Change-Id: I50ae128e4d2fe91f04e11bce438ea62e78334f16

entry.title: sql_built_in_recovery_lpm_fuzzer: Use queries_after_open input field
entry.content:
The fuzzer was accidentally reusing the `queries` field of its input

protobuf and ignoring the `queries_after_open` field of

`RecoveryFuzzerTestCase` (see sql_disk_corruption.proto).



This is a behavior change and will likely cause Clusterfuzz to mark its

existing crbugs as fixed. For the ones that we care about, we can

trivially create the equivalent new test case by copying the value of

the `queries` field into the `queries_after_open` field. It's also

likely the Clusterfuzz will rediscover the same crashes because I assume

copying a field is not a complex mutation.



Bug: 1520447

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac13%20Tests/8448/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/24606/overview

Original change's description:

> [Mac File Menu] Reland of Display and enable correct Close menu items

>

> Chrome Mac has "Close Tab" and "Close Window" menu items in the File

> men for browser windows, and just "Close Window" for non-browser

> windows. This cl fixes a problem where the "Close Tab" menu item

> would sometimes lose its Cmd-W keyboard shortcut.

> This is a reland of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4995772 . The original cl didn't catch a browser test that broke with the change.

entry.title: [Extensions] Test that confirms start worker behavior during running.
entry.content:
Before this test we didn't confirm that we do not attempt to start a

started/running worker with the

extensions_features::kExtensionsServiceWorkerOptimizedEventDispatch

feature.



After this change we can now confirm that it reduces the number of

redundant starts for a running worker (making this process more

efficient).

entry.title: Remove crashing CHECK
entry.content:
A recent CL changed the container type for tracking output streams from

std::list to std::unordered_set. It also added a CHECK making sure that

we were remove exactly one stream from the container when streams are

being released.



This CHECK is crashing, so this CL removes it. It is suprising that the

check is hit, but removing it should be safe: if the streams aren't

present in the container, there's nothing to remove.



The CHECK is crashing too frequently for this bug to not be fixed

immediately. There will a follow up investigation as to why this is

happening at all.



Fixed: 1521299

Change-Id: Ibc4667de036d7c02e65300070da3e6728263c97f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234565

Auto-Submit: Thomas Guilbert

entry.title: Reland "Support debug mode in auctionReportBuyers reporting"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 60e5bace38daf60d2212fe5e5f9595448cbcee93



Original change was speculatively reverted due to tryjob failures, but

another cl was the actual culprit.



Original change's description:

> Support debug mode in auctionReportBuyers reporting

>

> Adds support for enabling the Private Aggregation debug mode for this

> type of reporting. This is enabled through a new, optional field on the

> auctionConfig (defaulting to debug mode disabled).

>

> See the proposed explainer update here:

> https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/997

>

> This enables the new feature by default, but this feature will be

> disabled before reaching Stable if it not yet approved in an I2S.

entry.title: Update CanvasResourceProvider::Canvas() to return by reference
entry.content:
The paint canvas object is now guaranteed to always exists, so

returning by reference allows all caller to confidently use the canvas

without having to wonder whether the pointer is valid. Besides, callers

were never checking the pointer to start with.
